Yakutsk, the world‚Äôs coldest city is top of today‚Äôs list of Russia‚Äôs most polluted cities. Republic of Yakutia keeps battling both wildfires in the south-east and floods in the north. By earlier today 38,000 hectares of forests were on fire #wildfires2022Russia https://t.co/wotD1rjKwV

Yakutsk, capital city of Russia's largest and coldest region might get partially flooded tomorrow/on 16 July, local authorities warned. Floods continue in the north of republic. Picture from flooded Verkhoyansk, one of the coldest inhabited places on earth #floods2022Russia https://t.co/7sCnGqEaXy

Strong floods in the north of Yakutia reached the town of Verkhoyansk - The Pole of Cold - and destroyed part of the road connecting Yakutsk and Magadan, also known as The Road of Bones; the south & southeast of Russia's biggest republic are still battling #wildfires2022Russia https://t.co/Vx2trCjmmn
